dialogue: user: I need help with planning my Social Security survivor benefits.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need information about planning for your future Social Security survivor benefits?[NEWLINE]user: Yes.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What would my widower receive in benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: In the event of your passing, your widower would start receiving reduced benefits at age 60 or full benefits if they are at retirement age or older.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: I want to make sure that my family is financially taken care of after my passing. How do Social Security survivor benefits work?[NEWLINE]agent: Your Social Security can help ensure that your family is taken care of if you have earned enough credits through working.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What about my children? What would they receive?[NEWLINE]agent: Your children who are under 18 or age 19 if still attending school full time can receive Social Security benefits if they are unmarried.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need more information about this?

user: How do I apply for disability benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: I can help you with that. First off, you should apply for benefits as soon as you become disabled.[NEWLINE]agent: Are you interested in applying now?[NEWLINE]user: No, I don't think I am ready.[NEWLINE]agent: Ok, no problem. Are you deaf or hard of hearing?[NEWLINE]user: Oh, no. I am not.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you have access to a telephone?[NEWLINE]user: I do.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Do you have any documents or publications that I can read?[NEWLINE]agent: We do, what are you interested in? Applying online for disability benefits? We also have documents on disability benefits and a starter kit.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: I am wondering about if I don't have enough work credits to be eligible for disability. What should I do?

user: What documents do I need to get a corrected Social Security Card?[NEWLINE]agent: Citizenship is one option.[NEWLINE]agent: Have you established yourself as American citizen with us?[NEWLINE]user: No, I don't think that I have.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Can I use my US passport as proof of both being a citizen and my identity?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes you can.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Ok, I see what you mean by citizenship. A passport proves that?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, it does.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need to change your name on your Social Security Card?[NEWLINE]user: Not right now, but I might in the future. I am getting married next year.[NEWLINE]user: If I had changed my name what document would I need?[NEWLINE]agent: Any unexpired identity document in your new name, as long as we can find in our records your previous identity.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Is a passport ok?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes it is.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if my documentation in my old name has expired?

user: I need a corrected ss card for an adult[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need to egally change your name because of marriage, divorce, court order or any other reason[NEWLINE]user: no[NEWLINE]agent: are you working?[NEWLINE]user: N/A[NEWLINE]agent: Has your name changed?[NEWLINE]user: yes[NEWLINE]agent: If you do not tell us when your name changes it could  Prevent your wages from being posted correctly to your Social Security record[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What documents do I need as proof of identity?[NEWLINE]agent: U.S. driver 's license or State - issued non - driver identification card[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: will this cuase a delay when I file taxes?[NEWLINE]agent: it may which may lower the amount of your future Social Security benefits  and Cause delays when you file your taxes[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: will my new card have the same number as my old card?[NEWLINE]agent: Your new card will have the same number as your previous card  and will show your new name[NEWLINE]user: what documents do I need?

user: I need help with the retirement benefits planner[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need help with the online calculator WEP version?[NEWLINE]user: yes I do[NEWLINE]agent: The calculator allows you to estimate your Social Security benefit[NEWLINE]agent: Will you be working on something that needs more accurate estimates?[NEWLINE]user: no, just something to get an idea of what to expect[NEWLINE]user: whats with the retirement age being different?[NEWLINE]agent: If you qualify for benefits as a Survivor your full retirement age for survivors benefits may be different.[NEWLINE]user: Why does it do that thing when I enter my birhtday? it doesn't seem right[NEWLINE]agent: If your birthday falls on January 1st  we will figure your benefits as if your birthday was in the previous year.[NEWLINE]user: someone helped me before and we got different numbers, is that normal or were we using some other calculator?

user: Will I need specific documents to get a card?[NEWLINE]agent: You will need proof of citizenship.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you have a U.S. passport?[NEWLINE]user: No, no passport.[NEWLINE]user: Are there any other documents I can use?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, there are several other acceptable documents.[NEWLINE]user: Can I use a Certificate of Naturalization to prove citizenship?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, that is one of the accepted documents.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you have a Certificate of Naturalization or Citizenship?[NEWLINE]user: We lived outside the U.S., what do I need to prove my child's citizenship?[NEWLINE]agent: You can use a passport or school records.[NEWLINE]user: Can I use my child's school records to prove my citizenship?

user: What kind of documents are required to get a card?[NEWLINE]agent: You need an original proof of citizenship.[NEWLINE]agent: If it's for a child, you need a State issued birth certificate recorded before the child was 5.[NEWLINE]user: What if her birth certificate wasn't issued when she was born?[NEWLINE]agent: Does your child have a passport?[NEWLINE]user: No, she doesn't have a passport.[NEWLINE]user: What if I can't get a hold of the documents?[NEWLINE]agent: There are other documents we can consider, such as an employee ID card if it has your name, age, and is not expired.[NEWLINE]user: What can I use for a child without a passport?[NEWLINE]agent: You can submit an adoption decree or state issued ID card.[NEWLINE]user: My older child used to live in another country, how can I get him ma Social Security card?[NEWLINE]agent: Submit his passport or school records as proof he was never issued a SSN.[NEWLINE]user: Will you need proof of my identity?

user: I need help with replacement card for a noncitizen adult.[NEWLINE]agent: You can replace your Social Security card for free if it is lost or stolen; but you may also not need to replace your Social Security card.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you not have permission to work but need a Social Security number for other purposes?[NEWLINE]user: No I do not need the Social Security number for other purposes.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Do I need to have by Form I-20 with employment page completed and signed?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes you need to have your Form I-20 with employment page completed and signed by your designated school official.[NEWLINE]user: What if I need a number to meet my state or local requirements?[NEWLINE]agent: You will need to bring us a letter from the government agency and it must be on letterhead stationery but not on form letters or cannot be photocopied.[NEWLINE]user: What do I need to do if I am an F-1 or M-1 student?[NEWLINE]agent: You must show us your I-20 Certificate of Eligibility for Nonimmigrant Student Status.[NEWLINE]user: What happens if I am a J-1 student, student intern or international visitor?

user: I need a replacement card for a foreign born Us adult[NEWLINE]agent: You can replace your Social Security card for free if it is lost or stolen[NEWLINE]agent: Ok great! Do you have to be of a certain age to apply?[NEWLINE]user:  If you are age 18 or older with a U.S. mailing address and have amySocial Securityaccount[NEWLINE]agent:  For more information about creating my Social Security account and getting a replacement card online[NEWLINE]user: Ok awesome! thank you[NEWLINE]user: IS there a limit of replacement cards  i can get a year?[NEWLINE]agent: You are limited to three 3 replacement cards in a year and 10 during your lifetime[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: ok thank you. What documents do I need?[NEWLINE]agent: Oh yes there are. let me get those for you. If you have not already established your U.S. citizenship with us,  we need to see proof of U.S. citizenship. We can accept only certain documents as proof of U.S. citizenship.  These include :    U.S. passport ;    Certificate of Naturalization N-550/N-570 ;    Certificate of Citizenship N-560/N-561 ;    Certificate of Report of Birth DS-1350 ;   Consular Report of Birth Abroad FS-240, CRBA.[NEWLINE]user: ok and if I have not established citizenship?[NEWLINE]agent:  If you have not already established your U.S. citizenship with us,we need to see proof of U.S. citizenship.s   We can accept only certain documents as proof of U.S. citizenship.s    These include :s U.S. passport ; Certificate of Naturalization N-550/N-570 ; Certificate of Citizenship N-560/N-56 Certificate of Report of Birth DS-1350 ;   Consular Report of Birth Abroad FS-240, CRBA.[NEWLINE]user: What are the different ones that are accepted?

user: Please tell me the documents needed to get a Social Security card for a foreign-born adopted child.[NEWLINE]agent: You need to prove your child's citizenship.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you have your child's birth certificate?[NEWLINE]user: I have it.[NEWLINE]user: what documents can I use as proof of his citizenship?[NEWLINE]agent: You could use documents like his U.S. passport, Certificate of Naturalization (N-550/N-570) or Certificate of Citizenship (N-560/N-561).[NEWLINE]user: And for me, do I need to show proof of identity, and what if I can't get a required document?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, you also must prove your identity. If you can't get any of the required documents you'll get asked for another suitable document, like your employee identification card.[NEWLINE]user: Can I use an expired document?[NEWLINE]agent: not, it must be current and show all the necessary identifying information, including a recent photograph.[NEWLINE]user: Now, what if my son lived outside the US for a long time?.

user: hello, hope you are well. How do I get an original card for a foreign Born Us citizen?[NEWLINE]agent: Hello! I hope you are well too. I will be glad to help you with that. one moment please while I check...You must present original documents or copies certified by the agency that issued them.[NEWLINE]agent: DOes this apply to you or a member of you r family?[NEWLINE]user: yes it does.[NEWLINE]agent:  If you want to claim your child for tax purposes while the adoption is still pending  contact the Internal Revenue Service for Form W-7A, Application for Taxpayer Identification Number for Pending[NEWLINE]user: Where can I get more information?[NEWLINE]agent: For more information, see Social Security Numbers For Children (Publication No.   [16] 05-10023)[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Will a us passport work?[NEWLINE]agent: We may accept the following as evidence of U.S. citizenship :    Certificate of Citizenship N-560/N-561 ;    Certificate of Naturalization N-550/N-570 ;      Machine Readable Immigrant Visa MRIV showing a category code of IR3 or IH3 ; [26] or   U.S. passport.[NEWLINE]agent: you must get present the birthcertificate within 10 days or get one[NEWLINE]user: if not then what?

user: Hello. I understand I need original documents, but which ones?[NEWLINE]agent: Hello. Thank you for asking. I will be glad to assist you with that We can accept only certain documents as proof of U.S. citizenship.   These include a U.S. birth certificate or a U.S. passport.] AgeYou must present your birth certificate[NEWLINE]agent: Does a birth certificate exist?[NEWLINE]user: yes[NEWLINE]agent: Great! Then we ca accept that[NEWLINE]user: What if a social security family was never assigned?[NEWLINE]agent: Sure! I will be glad to assist you. Here are examples of documents you can use to prove a Social Security number was never assigned  Sure! I will be glad to assist you.  If you lived outside the United States for an extended period,  a current or previous passport,s school and/or employment records[NEWLINE]user: What will you use these documents for?[NEWLINE]agent: We may use one document for two purposes  For example, we may use your U.S. passport as proof of both citizenship and identity[NEWLINE]user: What if a birth certificate does not exist?[NEWLINE]agent: If a birth certificate does not exist  we may be able to accept your :s  Religious record made before the age of 5 showing your date of birth ;s   U.S. hospital record of your birth[NEWLINE]user: Do you need any other information?[NEWLINE]agent:  we may ask you for information about the schools you attended or we may ask you to provide copies of tax records that would show you were never assigned a Social Security number[NEWLINE]user: What if the person is 12 years old?

user: It's my first time trying to get a social security card. I'm a noncitizen adult.[NEWLINE]agent: You need to prove your immigration status.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you want to know how to do it?[NEWLINE]user: Yes please, tell me.[NEWLINE]agent: You have to provide us with your current U.S. immigration document. The forms I-551 Lawful Permanent Resident Card, Machine Readable Immigrant Visa with your unexpired foreign passport and  I-766 Employment Authorization Document, EAD, work permit are good to show.[NEWLINE]user: And to prove my age if I can't find my birth certificate?[NEWLINE]agent: We could ask you for another suitable document, like your passport or a document issued by DHS as evidence of your age.[NEWLINE]user: And how can I prove that I lived outside the US?[NEWLINE]agent: You can use your current or previous passport or show us your school records or work records from the country you used to live.[NEWLINE]user: what if I don't have permission to work but need the social security number to apply for government benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: You can actually apply for a social security number if you are required to provide your social security number by a state or local law to get general assistance benefits.[NEWLINE]user: What would happen if I use a non-work social security number for work?[NEWLINE]agent: You shouldn't do it but if you do it we would inform the DHS.[NEWLINE]user: Is there another document that I can use to prove my immigration status?

user: Good morning. I'm parent of a foreign born U.S citizen child and need to get her a SSN card, could you tell me about it?[NEWLINE]agent: No problem. To do that, you'll need to prove first the child's citizenship, so you'll have to present some documents, such as certification of report of birth, consular report of birth abroad or U.S passport.[NEWLINE]agent: I assume you don't have any of these documents?[NEWLINE]user: No, i don't, no.[NEWLINE]user: Oh, hey, i was wondering if it is possible to present other documents as proof?[NEWLINE]agent: Sure. In that case, just certain documents are accepted, and these should have child's name, date of birth or age, and a recent photograph, to be acceptable.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: So, those would be helpful to get that SSN card, isn't?[NEWLINE]agent: That's correct. Be aware though that any document you present must be originals or copies certified by the agency that issued them. Of course, must be unexpired too.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Ok, ok, i get it. But, just to be sure, what about if  i don't have any of these document at hand?[NEWLINE]agent: You have an option, too. We'll ask you other documents, and as said before, these documents must be unexpired and include key information about you, plus a recent photograph.[NEWLINE]user: I don't want to be pesky about this, but, what if i really don't have a document like that at hand?[NEWLINE]agent: Well, that would be a real extraordinary scenario. Still, we can accept in any case a state issued non driver identification card or even, if that's the case, an adoption decree.[NEWLINE]user: But, if i only had the child's certification of report of birth, that could work, right?

user: tell me more about my Social Security benefits[NEWLINE]agent: Are you retired?[NEWLINE]user: yes[NEWLINE]agent: Are you disabled?[NEWLINE]user: yes I am[NEWLINE]agent: Did you want to know how Social Security can provide your family with benefits when you die?[NEWLINE]user: that could help[NEWLINE]agent: Social Security can provide your spouse and other eligible members of your family with benefits when you die.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: is there a way to look at what more or less we can get from these benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: You can use one of our benefit calculators to estimate your future retirement, disability, and survivors benefits[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: can you help me with what benefits we can get?

user: Could you please give me some information about survivors' benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: We do have a survivors planner that you can use to see what best suits your particular situation.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What can I do if I do not have enough Social Security credits to qualify for benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: You can use one of our benefit calculators to estimate your future retirement, disability, and survivors benefits if you want an estimate.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: If I have never worked, can I still qualify for spousal benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: You may still qualify for benefits if you are the spouse or divorced spouse of a retired worker even if you have never worked.[NEWLINE]user: Am I eligible for benefits based on my ex-spouse?[NEWLINE]agent: Even if you never worked under Social Security, you may still qualify for benefits if you are the spouse or divorced spouse of a retired worker.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What about my benefits at the time of my passing?[NEWLINE]agent: You can use our Survivors Planner to learn how your family members will be protected if you die.[NEWLINE]user: Do all workers with children have survivors' benefits?

user: Can you help me out with the benefits planner for retirement?[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need to learn about the government pension offset or GPO?[NEWLINE]user: No, that is not what I need to know.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Do you need info to calculate your benefits if they are affected by the GPO?[NEWLINE]user: No, I do not need info to calculate benefits affected by GPO.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Would you need to know if you will be eligible for spouses benefits and have access to your spouse's estimate?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I need to know if I would be eligible for spouses benefits and have access to estimate.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you know how to find the estimate amount of the retirement benefit your spouse would be eligible to receive at full retirement age?[NEWLINE]user: No, I do not know how to find the estimated amount.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you know you would have to divide the amount in half and round down to the nearest dollar?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I know what I need to do math wise.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Then your estimated monthly amount of your Social Security benefit as a spouse, widow, or widower before the effect of GPO would be what you need to know.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Is there something I could read about requirements for an exemption?

user: Could you help me with the Retirement Benefits Planner?[NEWLINE]agent: Would you like to know about Government Pension Offset pertaining to retirement?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I would like to learn about GPO.[NEWLINE]agent: Will you receive a pension for work not covered by Social Security such as government employment?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I will receive a pension for work not covered by Social Security.[NEWLINE]agent: Then any Social Security you would receive on your spouse's record may be reduced.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Could I get access to my spouse's estimates of benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: Did you find the amount of the retirement benefit your spouse would be eligible to receive at full retirement age?[NEWLINE]user: No, I did not find that amount yet.[NEWLINE]agent: Did you know that you need to divide the amount your spouse gets in half and round down to the nearest dollar?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I am aware of the calculations I have to do.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Then you should be able to find the amount of estimated monthly Social Security benefit you would receive as a spouse.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Are any individuals exempt from the offset?

user: What age should I start my benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: Sure I can help you with that information[NEWLINE]user: The answer is that there is no one " best age " for everyone and, ultimately, it is your choice[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: DoI need to sign up for medicare?[NEWLINE]agent: Please read the general and special enrollment period information on page 12 of our Medicare booklet to find out what may happen if you delay[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if my parents didnt grow up in the 1980's, should I still apply?[NEWLINE]agent:  you may choose to start receiving retirement benefits earlie[NEWLINE]user: Is there a best age to get benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: The answer is that there is no one " best age " for everyone and, ultimately, it is your choice[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Do I need to apply for medicare? If so why?

user: Could you please help me? I need to find out how to get an replacement card for a non citizen child that I have in my care.[NEWLINE]agent: You can replace your child's Social Security card free if it is lost or stolen. You are limited to three replacement cards in a year and 10 in a lifetime. Legal name changes and other exception do not count toward these limits.[NEWLINE]agent: For what purpose does your child need a Social Security number, is he/she permitted to work?[NEWLINE]user: My child does not have permission to work.[NEWLINE]user: What other exceptions don't count towards the limit to the number of replacement cards that can be issued?[NEWLINE]agent: Changes such as immigration status that require card updates may not count toward the limit.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: When I apply for the replacement card what documents do I need and do they have to be original documents?[NEWLINE]agent: You will have to provide us your Form I-20 with the employment page completed and signed by your designated school official.[NEWLINE]user: What is my child is a J-1 or J-2 exchange visitor?[NEWLINE]agent: This you can see on your child's DS-2019 Certificate of Eligibility for Exchange Visitor Status.[NEWLINE]user: What other document can be submitted to obtain a replacement card?

user: Hello I need information about What happens after I apply for retirement benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: Once we receive your request, we will review it. After the review, we will contact you if we need more information or if we need to see your documents.[NEWLINE]user: and after the review?[NEWLINE]agent: We will contact you if we need more information or if we need to see your documents.[NEWLINE]user: Is it possible that I may receive benefits on someone else's record?[NEWLINE]agent: We will gladly let you know this after reviewing[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Where can i get more information?[NEWLINE]agent: You can call us by phone: Call 1-800-772-1213. TTY 1 - 800 - 325 - 0778 from 7 AM to 7 PM Monday through Friday. we will gladly assist you[NEWLINE]user: and are there other ways to apply for retirement benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: of course[NEWLINE]agent: you don't live in the usa?[NEWLINE]user: yes, I am not a US resident

user: For what reasons does Social Security provide people with benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: Do you have a wife and children?[NEWLINE]user: I do.[NEWLINE]agent: Social Security can provide you, your spouse, and other eligible members of your family with benefits when you retire and on other occasions.[NEWLINE]user: I am preparing for retirement.  Can you tell me what I would need to know beforehand?[NEWLINE]agent: I can, but are you in any way disabled?[NEWLINE]user: I am not.  I am simply preparing to retire from the workforce.[NEWLINE]agent: Ok, if you are not disabled and are not retiring right now, we do not need to do any processing at this moment.[NEWLINE]user: Are there any tools that I could use to prepare for coming out of the workforce?[NEWLINE]agent: You can use our planners to help you to better understand your Social Security protection as you plan for your financial future.  Then you can choose a benefit calculator to get estimates of benefits you and your family may be eligible for.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What happens to those who survive me if I am dependent on Social Security as my income?

user: What will the benefits planner used for?[NEWLINE]agent: Do you want to get Social Security benefits for you, your spouse, or your family.[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I would like to apply.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you know you can get Social Security benefits when you retire?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I know this.[NEWLINE]agent: Are you disabled?[NEWLINE]user: No, I am not.[NEWLINE]agent: Then you wouldn't be able to get Social Security disability for you, your spouse, or eligible family.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Are there any online tools available for me estimate calculations?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, we have a few benefits calculators online to help you plan.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: When should I apply for benefits?

user: What kind of retirement benefits do I need?[NEWLINE]agent: Are you retired?[NEWLINE]user: No I am not yet retired.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Can you apply online?[NEWLINE]user: Yes I can[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Who can apply for benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: You can apply online for retirement benefits or benefits as a spouse if you are at least 61 years and 8 months old[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if I am having an issue with it[NEWLINE]agent:  you can find additional information in our [ More Info ] links[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: I have not applied for retiremtn can I still apply?[NEWLINE]agent: You can apply online for retirement benefits or benefits as a spouse if you[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: You 'll get a receipt for your online application

user: Will my children get benefits as well?[NEWLINE]agent: Are you or a spouse on disability?[NEWLINE]user: yes we both are.[NEWLINE]agent: ok no problem. Thanks for the response your children may also qualify to receive benefits on your record[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: How old do they need to be? My spouse that is[NEWLINE]agent: your ex - spouse must be at least 62 years old[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Are there any books or pages i can read about this?[NEWLINE]agent: please refer to  Disability Benefits article[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: ok thanks[NEWLINE]agent:  the child must be unmarried[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: are there any publication abpout this?

user: Will I be eligible for spouse's benefits and have access to my spouse's benefits?[NEWLINE]agent: Do you want to find the estimated amount of the retirement benefit you spouse would get at full retirement?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, that is what I would like to know.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Then the  estimated monthly amount of you Social Security amount as a spouse, widow, or widower before the effect of GPO is what you need to look at.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if I will be eligible for widow's benefits or I do not have access to my spouse's estimates?[NEWLINE]agent: You could call our toll free number at 1-800-772-1213 or if you are hard of hearing at 1-800-325-0778 or just contact your local Social Security office.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What happens if I retire before full retirement age?[NEWLINE]agent: Your benefit amount as a spouse would be reduced and would vary based on your birth date.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you need to find out more info about estimated benefit amount if you retire before reaching full retirement age?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I need to find out more info about my estimated benefit amount if I retire before full retirement age.[NEWLINE]agent: Call our toll free number at 1-800-772-1213 or at 1-800-325-0778 if hard of hearing or your local office.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if I am eligible for Social Security retirement benefit based on my own earnings?[NEWLINE]agent: Do you know it will affect you as a higher benefit based on your spouses earnings?

user: I'm applying for retirement benefits and want to know how much my wife would get.[NEWLINE]agent: I can help you figure this out. Are you looking for the estimated amount that she would receive at full retirement age?[NEWLINE]user: No, she already receives her own benefits.[NEWLINE]agent: Okay. Would you like me to help you calculate her benefit?[NEWLINE]user: No, I just found out how to do it online. Just divide the amount and round down to the nearest dollar.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Be advised that this amount would be different if you are affected by the GPO.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Okay. How can I find more information about my benefit amount if I choose to retire before full retirement age?[NEWLINE]agent: You can always call our toll free number at 1-800-772-1213 or contact your local Social Security office for more information.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Will they be able to help me calculate my own benefits?[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Absolutely. If you do not have access to your spouse's estimate or records, just call our toll free number for help.[NEWLINE]user: Yes. I do not have access to her records and will be needing help.

user: Hi, how you doing. Look, i'm looking for information about what original documents do i need related to replacing a SSN card for a child, please?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, no problem. The documents you need will serve to prove child's U.S citizenship. There is only certain documents that we can accept in that regard.[NEWLINE]agent: Have you already established the child's U.S citizenship with us?[NEWLINE]user: No, i hadn't do that.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: That got me thinking. Please, that card can be replaced, isn't?[NEWLINE]agent: Sure, sure. The child's SSN card can be replaced free of charge in case is lost or stolen. you should know that you have a limit for that operation, up to 3 times in a year and up to 10 times during your lifetime.[NEWLINE]user: Oh, i didn't knew that. Look, can i present copies of the documents?[NEWLINE]agent: That's not possible, sorry. Those documents you should present, must be original or if they are copies, must be certified by that agency that issued them. We won't accept notarized copies, either. Of course, these documents mus be current and not expired.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Uh, mus take that into account. And, in any case, i could present other documents to you?[NEWLINE]agent: It is possible, yes. Any document presented must show your name, date of birth or age, and a recent photograph. This document could be, for example, a employee identification card.[NEWLINE]user: Oh, oh, another question please. Could you tell me with what purposes you use a document?[NEWLINE]agent: Well, that would depend on the document presented, but for example we could use your U.S passport as proof of both citizenship and identity.[NEWLINE]user: Ok. um, lets say i don't have a document available to present, do i have any options regarding that?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, you have an option. We may accept some other document, such as a state issued non driver identification card or, in case your child is adopted, a adoption decree.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: All right. user: Hello, I wwas wondering where I begin?[NEWLINE]agent: Hope all is well. user: Will a student loan deferment help me out if i need to stop making payments?[NEWLINE]agent: You can see if a deferment is right for you and you would not have to make a payment but you won't be making any progress toward forgiveness or paying your loan back.[NEWLINE]user: Are there any other alternatives that make sense?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, you could always try an income-driven repayment.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What is a graduate fellowship deferment?[NEWLINE]agent: It is a deferment that if you are enrolled in an approved graduate fellowship program, which is one that provides financial support to graduate students to pursue graduate studies and research, you are eligible for the deferment.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Could I be eligible for the military service deferment?[NEWLINE]agent: Are you on active duty military service in connection with a war, military operation, or national emergency?[NEWLINE]user: yes, I am in military service.[NEWLINE]agent: Then you could be eligible for the military service deferment.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Am I making progress toward forgiveness when on an deferment?

user:  What is the feedback center for?[NEWLINE]agent:  You can use the feedback center to give us feedback regarding any complaint, issue, concern, suspicious activity, or scam that you are aware of or simply to giving us positive feedback or to review an already submitted case.[NEWLINE]user: What if I don't agree with the response to my submitted complaint?[NEWLINE]agent: In that case, you should follow our procedure for resolving disputes before contacting the Federal Student Aid Ombudsman Group.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Can you guys help me in any other way?[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Do you want to speak with an agent?[NEWLINE]user: Not really.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]agent: Are you interested in our popular topics?[NEWLINE]user: Not right now.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What kind of positive feedback can I give?

user: What are Direct PLUs Loans?[NEWLINE]agent: PLUS loans are federal loans that parents get to help their dependent pay for education expenses.[NEWLINE]user: Could I apply online?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, you can fill out the online application for a parent PLUS loan.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: How much am I allowed to borrow with a PLUS loan?[NEWLINE]agent: The most you can borrow with a PLUS loan is the cost of attendance at the school your child would attend minus any other financial assistance and the school determines what the cost of attending there is.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What must I do to receive a parent PLUS loan?[NEWLINE]agent: Are you the biological or adoptive parent or a step-parent of a dependent undergraduate student who would be enrolled at least half time?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I am a parent of a dependent undergraduate student that will be attending full time.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you not have an bad credit history?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, my credit is not bad.[NEWLINE]agent: Do you meet the general eligibility requirements for federal student aid?[NEWLINE]user: No, I do not.

user: What are the next steps involved after I submit my FAFSA form for federal student aid?[NEWLINE]agent: Firstly, you will need to check that all the information that you supplied is correct and completed in full as it appears on your Student Aid Report (SAR)[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: How do I receive my SAR after submitting my FAFSA form?[NEWLINE]agent: By providing us with a valid email address, you will receive an email from noreply@FAFSA.gov. This will give you instructions as to how you access your SAR online[NEWLINE]user: What if I have no email address, how do I receive my SAR in this case?[NEWLINE]agent: With no email address, you will receive a SAR or a SAR acknowledgment via postal mail[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: How do I get a copy of my SAR if I am unable to log into the fafsa.gov website?[NEWLINE]agent: You can contact the Federal Student Aid Information Center at 1-800-4-FED-AID 1-800-433-3243. You request a copy of your SAR through this phone service and a copy will be sent to you via the mail, please allow 10-14 days for delivery[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: When looking at my SAR, I noticed a mistake. What can I do to rectify this?[NEWLINE]agent: Have you reviewed your SAR fully and found there to be errors present?

user: How is the amount of my federal student aid figured out?[NEWLINE]agent: When you fill out your FAFSA form the college you list will use the information you provided.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: How does my school figure out the non-need based aid?[NEWLINE]agent: Your school has a formula they use to calculate they non-need based aid.[NEWLINE]agent: Will this example help you, "If you have cost of attendance at $16000 and you have been awarded a total of $4000 in need-based aid and private scholarships, the you can get $12000 in non-need based aid."[NEWLINE]user: No, it does not help me understand it at all.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if my COA is $16000 and my EFC is $12000?[NEWLINE]agent: Then your financial need is $4000.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What does cost of attendance or COA actually mean?[NEWLINE]agent: Your COA is the amount you will pay to go to school.[NEWLINE]agent: Are you attending at least half-time?[NEWLINE]user: Yes, I will be attending at least half-time.

user: Is it wise to compare school aid offers I get from each college?[NEWLINE]agent: Have you applied at several colleges?[NEWLINE]user: No, i have not yet.[NEWLINE]user: Will my aid amount be the same at each school?[NEWLINE]agent: Actually, each financial aid package is different because each college is different in what they offer.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: How do I figure out net price for my school?[NEWLINE]agent: There are easy steps to follow when figuring out net price of net cost.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: Is it best to look at each cost per school for aid offerings?[NEWLINE]agent: Yes, always be sure to compare aid offerings from each school to see which will be most affordable.[NEWLINE][BOUNDARY][NEWLINE]user: What if the school i want to attend does not list the cost of attendance on the aid offer?
